conclusion: Problem involves shadows cast by objects and how they change with light source movement.
Four objects casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on a green surface.
Task is to describe changes in shadows' position and size when light source moves to back right.
Current light source is overhead as shadows are directly below objects.
Back right means light comes from behind objects and to the right.
Shadows will move towards the front left when light source moves to back right.
Shadows will be elongated towards the front left.
Shadow A is from a dessert or cake on a plate.
Shadow B is from a tall, thin object, possibly a candle or a stick.
Shadow C is from a roll of paper towels with a red cross symbol.
Shadow D is from a circular object, maybe a ring or a hoop.
Need to consider how each shadow changes with light source movement.
